content.question: ​Which of the following describes the graph of <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals cot x"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>cot</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​​The graph has vertical asymptotes at <math alttext="x equals pi over 2 plus pi k"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi>π</mi><mi>k</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, where <math alttext="k"><semantics><mi>k</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is any integer, and the function is increasing on all intervals in its domain.

​​The graph has vertical asymptotes at <math alttext="x equals pi over 2 plus pi k"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi>π</mi><mi>k</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, where <math alttext="k"><semantics><mi>k</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is any integer, and the function is decreasing on all intervals in its domain.

​​The graph has vertical asymptotes at <math alttext="x equals pi plus pi k"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>π</mi><mi>k</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, where <math alttext="k"><semantics><mi>k</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is any integer, and the function is increasing on all intervals in its domain.

​The graph has vertical asymptotes at <math alttext="x equals pi plus pi k"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>π</mi><mi>k</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, where <math alttext="k"><semantics><mi>k</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is any integer, and the function is decreasing on all intervals in its domain.

content.answer: ​The graph has vertical asymptotes at <math alttext="x equals pi plus pi k"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>π</mi><mi>k</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, where <math alttext="k"><semantics><mi>k</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is any integer, and the function is decreasing on all intervals in its domain.

topic.text: 3.11: The Secant, Cosecant, and Cotangent Functions

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
